summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Board of Adjustment (Panel C) will convene on June 17, 2024, for a briefing at 10:00 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place at Dallas City Hall in the L1FN Auditorium and will also be accessible via videoconference. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss various applications for special exceptions and other related business.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, public hearing, public testimony, and miscellaneous items such as the approval of the minutes from the previous meeting on May 20, 2024. The Board will address uncontested items, holdover items, and individual cases.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include multiple applications for special exceptions related to fence height and standards, as well as parking regulations. Specific cases include requests from Rob Baldwin, Jennifer Hiromoto, Kennan Young, and Jordan Corbitt, each seeking variances for their respective properties.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is expected to make decisions on the applications for special exceptions, including those for fence height and parking regulations. Approval of the previous meeting's minutes will also be sought. Public participation is encouraged, with registration required by June 16, 2024, for those wishing to speak.
